intro: Crotalaria debilis, commonly known as the weak bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. Its pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Crotalaria debilis is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
